name: get_business_profile_data
description: Retrieves profile data for a TikTok account, including its analytics and insights. Optionally, filter the returned data by a specific date range or by requesting specific fields such as `username`, `display_name`, `profile`, `analytics`, or `settings`.

access_token.description: An access token, provided as a string, that has been authorized by TikTok creators.

business_id.description: A unique identifier for a TikTok account, specific to this application.

start_date.description: Specifies the query start date. This date must be provided in `YYYY-MM-DD` format and defaults to `None`.

end_date.description: The query end date, which must be specified in YYYY-MM-DD format. This parameter defaults to `None`.

fields.description: A list of requested fields to include in the response, filtering the returned data to only these specified fields. Valid options are `username`, `display_name`, `profile`, `analytics`, and `settings`. This parameter defaults to `None`.

name: get_business_publish_status
description: Retrieves the publishing status for a TikTok video or photo post, indicating if the publishing task is complete or in progress.

access_token.description: An access token specifically authorized by TikTok creators.

business_id.description: An application-specific unique identifier for the TikTok account.

publish_id.description: A unique string identifier for a post publishing task, specifically referencing the publishing of a TikTok video or photo post.

name: publish_business_video
description: Publish a public video post to a TikTok account. This function allows uploading and publishing videos with various customization options for visibility and interaction settings.

access_token.description: An access token authorized by TikTok creators.

content_type.description: Specifies the content type for the request. This parameter must be set to `application/json`.

business_id.description: An application-specific unique identifier for the TikTok account.

video_url.description: Specifies the URL of the video to be published to the TikTok account.

post_info.description: A dictionary that provides additional information about the video post. It must include the `title` (string), `description` (string), `tags` (list of strings), `thumbnail_url` (string), `thumbnail_offset` (integer time offset in seconds for the thumbnail), and `is_ai_generated` (boolean indicating if the content is AI-generated).

title.description: A string representing the title for the video.

description.description: A string containing the description of the video.

tags.description: A list of strings representing tags for the video.

thumbnail_url.description: Specifies the URL for the video's thumbnail.

thumbnail_offset.description: The time offset in seconds for the video thumbnail.

is_ai_generated.description: Indicates whether the video content being published was generated by artificial intelligence.

caption.description: Specifies the caption text (string) for the video. This parameter defaults to `None`.

is_brand_organic.description: Indicates whether the post is organic branded content. This parameter defaults to `False`.

is_branded_content.description: Indicates whether the post is branded content. This parameter defaults to `False`.

disable_comment.description: A boolean indicating whether to disable comments for the video. This parameter defaults to `False`, which means comments are enabled by default.

disable_duet.description: Specifies whether to disable the duet feature for the video. This parameter defaults to `False`.

disable_stitch.description: A boolean indicating whether to disable the stitch feature for the video. It defaults to `False`, meaning the stitch feature is enabled by default.

thumbnail_offset.description: The time offset in seconds for the video thumbnail. This parameter defaults to 0.

is_ai_generated.description: A boolean flag indicating whether the content is AI-generated, defaulting to `False`.

upload_to_draft.description: Determines whether to save the video post as a draft instead of publishing it. This parameter defaults to `False`.
